result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 8:49 AM Defendant Brandon Michael Louder appeared by video.  Attorney Richard A Coad appeared by video for Brandon Michael Louder.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Felony Hold Open Agreement filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to count one.  Court withholds finding of guilt on count pending Felony Hold Open Agreement. Defendant pleads no contest to counts two, three, and four. Court finds the defendant guilty. Court orders sentence withheld, two years probation with conditions, Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary, Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary, Must complete Domestic Violence Intervention Program, Anger Management Classes, No Contact with C.A.P. and M.A.P., Possess no weapons/firearms, Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional. Court costs due December 2 2022. Count five is dismissed and read in. If defendant successfully completes all conditions of hold open agreement, defendant may petition to dismiss count 1 only. 2 days credit.
Agreement to hold open felony plea
